issue.title: [Python] Add a migration path for external packages due to Python code being moved to PyArrow
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-16346](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16346). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Try to find a viable migration path so that external packages can use Python C++ API as before.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16346?focusedCommentId=17575606) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16346?focusedCommentId=17575709) by Alenka Frim (alenka):*
No, there seem to be no need to change anything. See last item on todo
list: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13311#issue-1259928949

Also the cython tests that check this are passing (except the Windows issue
I have to solve).
